title: How to use `NMA`: Introduction
text: document describes use main functions NMA run single network meta-analysis.

title: How to use `NMA`: Introduction
code: library(NMA) library(dplyr) library(BRugs) library(purrr)

title: How to use `NMA`: Introduction
text: Define BUGS parameters MCMC. Define scenario use analysis.
code: bugs_params <-   list(     PROG = "openBugs",     N.BURNIN = 10,#00,     N.SIMS = 150,#0,     N.CHAINS = 2,     N.THIN = 1,     PAUSE = TRUE) RANDOM <- FALSE REFTX <- "ERL/GEF" is_bin <- TRUE is_med <- TRUE label_name <- "BC_PFS_mFE" endpoint <- "PFS" analysis_type <- "BC"

title: How to use `NMA`: Introduction
text: trials data consist 3 separate dataframes. main table, subData, optional tables median event time binary data, subDataMed subDataBin respectively.
code: file_name <- paste0(here::here("raw_data"), "/survdata_", endpoint, "_")  subData <-   read.csv(paste0(file_name, analysis_type, ".csv"),            header = TRUE,            as.is = TRUE)  subDataBin <-   if (is_bin) {     read.csv(paste0(file_name, "bin.csv"),              header = TRUE,              as.is = TRUE)   } else {NA}  subDataMed <-   if (is_med) {     read.csv(paste0(file_name, "med.csv"),              header = TRUE,              as.is = TRUE) %>%        mutate(medR = floor(medR))   } else {NA}

title: How to use `NMA`: Introduction
text: Now can create NMA object use modelling. can view network graph.
code: nma_model <-   new_NMA(subData = subData,           subDataMed = subDataMed,           subDataBin = subDataBin,           bugs_params = bugs_params,           is_random = RANDOM,           refTx = REFTX ,           effectParam = "beta",           modelParams = "totresdev",           label = label_name,           endpoint = endpoint)  nma_model #> $dat #> $dat$inits #> function() { #>       list( #>         beta = c(NA, rnorm(nTx - 1, 0, 2)), #>         sd = 0.1, #>         alpha = rnorm(nStudies)) %>%  #>         .[param_names] #>     } #> <bytecode: 0x00000000160d9d18> #> <environment: title: How to use `NMA`: Introduction
code: nma_res <- NMA_run(nma_model) #> ====== RUNNING BUGS MODEL #> model is syntactically correct #> data loaded #> model compiled #> Initializing chain 1: #> initial values loaded and chain initialized but another chain contain uninitialized variables #> Initializing chain 2: #> model is initialized #> model is already initialized #> Sampling has been started ... #> 10 updates took 0 s #> deviance set #> monitor set for variable 'beta' #> monitor set for variable 'totresdev' #> monitor set for variable 'deviance' #> 150 updates took 0 s #> Warning in dir.create(path = here(folder)): 'C: #> \Users\n8tha\Documents\R\NMA\output' already exists  nma_res #> Inference for Bugs model at "C:/Users/n8tha/Documents/R/NMA/inst/FE_med_bin.txt", fit using OpenBUGS, #>  2 chains, each with 160 iterations (first 10 discarded) #>  n.sims = 300 iterations saved #>                   mean          sd  2.5%   25%   50%    75%  97.5% Rhat n.eff #> beta[2]           -0.6 9.00000e-01  -2.0  -1.2  -0.8    0.4    0.8  3.6     2 #> beta[3]           -1.8 7.00000e-01  -2.6  -2.3  -2.1   -1.1   -0.8  2.1     4 #> beta[4]            0.5 1.00000e-01   0.2   0.4   0.5    0.6    0.7  1.0    82 #> beta[5]           -0.5 1.00000e+00  -1.6  -1.2  -0.9    0.9    1.3  3.3     3 #> beta[6]           -0.8 1.00000e+00  -3.0  -1.5  -0.4   -0.3    0.4  2.9     3 #> beta[7]           -0.5 1.00000e-01  -0.7  -0.6  -0.5   -0.4   -0.3  1.0   300 #> beta[8]           -0.1 2.00000e-01  -0.4  -0.2  -0.1    0.0    0.2  1.0   300 #> beta[9]           -0.5 1.00000e-01  -0.7  -0.5  -0.5   -0.4   -0.2  1.0   280 #> beta[10]          -0.2 6.00000e-01  -1.2  -0.4  -0.2    0.2    0.7  1.2    15 #> beta[11]           1.2 9.00000e-01  -1.7   0.9   1.3    1.9    2.4  1.0   300 #> beta[12]          -0.7 1.00000e-01  -0.9  -0.8  -0.7   -0.6   -0.5  1.0   300 #> beta[13]          -0.4 3.00000e-01  -0.9  -0.6  -0.4   -0.2    0.2  1.0   230 #> beta[14]          -0.2 8.00000e+00  -1.2  -0.2  -0.2   -0.1    1.1  1.3   300 #> beta[15]           0.0 2.00000e-01  -0.3  -0.1   0.0    0.2    0.4  1.0   300 #> beta[16]          -0.3 2.00000e-01  -0.6  -0.4  -0.3   -0.2    0.1  1.0   300 #> beta[17]          -0.9 7.00000e-01  -2.3  -1.8  -0.6   -0.4   -0.1  1.0   300 #> beta[18]           0.8 5.00000e-01   0.0   0.5   0.7    1.4    1.7  3.4     3 #> beta[19]          -0.9 1.00000e+00  -2.2  -1.7  -1.3    0.4    1.0  3.2     3 #> beta[20]          -1.2 1.10000e+00  -2.6  -2.0  -1.6    0.0    0.8  3.2     3 #> beta[21]           0.3 3.00000e-01  -0.3   0.1   0.3    0.5    0.9  1.0   300 #> beta[22]          -0.8 1.00000e-01  -1.0  -0.8  -0.8   -0.7   -0.6  1.0   300 #> beta[23]          -0.5 1.00000e-01  -0.8  -0.6  -0.5   -0.4   -0.3  1.0   300 #> beta[24]           0.5 4.00000e-01  -0.3   0.2   0.5    0.7    1.2  1.1    19 #> totresdev        902.0 7.53200e+02 218.7 363.1 446.7 1737.4 2286.8  1.1    23 #> deviance  1200000976.3 1.19598e+10 234.0 379.7 461.9 1772.3 3529.2  1.2   300 #>  #> For each parameter, n.eff is a crude measure of effective sample size, #> and Rhat is the potential scale reduction factor (at convergence, Rhat=1). #>  #> DIC info (using the rule, pD = Dbar-Dhat) #> pD = 1.2e+09 and DIC = 2.4e+09 #> DIC is an estimate of expected predictive error (lower deviance is better).  # diagnostics(nma_res) # nma_outputs(nma_res)

title: How to use `NMA`: Introduction
text: simple modify existing analysis without repeating previous steps. example, can run NMA random effects model version model.
code: ##TODO: error  # Error in scan(paste(tempDir, "/output", i, ".txt", sep = ""), switch(cmdtypes[i], :  # scan() expected 'a real', got '1.#INF00'  nma_model2 <-   NMA_update(nma_model,              is_random = TRUE)  nma_res2 <- NMA_run(nma_model2,                     output_dir = "RE output")  nma_res2  # diagnostics(nma_res2, save = TRUE) # nma_outputs(nma_res2, save = TRUE)

title: Running an NMA with a Reference file
text: idea create folder information needed run NMA analysis contained files within. meta information contents folder contained reference file. reference file called REFERENCE.csv.

title: Running an NMA with a Reference file
text: file contains two columns called type file. Rows type column must contain one following keywords: bugs: file containing BUGS input parameters MCMC. analysis: file containing scenario information, including random effects model, RANDOM reference treatment, REFTX. subData: Mandatory NMA data. subDataBin: Optional binary data. subDataMed: Optional median time data.

title: Running an NMA with a Reference file
text: example, bugs.csv analysis.csv
code: PROG, openBugs, N.BURNIN, 1000, N.SIMS, 1500, N.CHAINS, 2, N.THIN, 1, PAUSE, TRUE RANDOM, TRUE, REFTX, 1

title: Running an NMA with a Reference file
text: single call sets-NMA represented contents folder.
code: nma_model <- new_NMA_dir(dir = "analysis_folder/)

title: Run multiple NMA
text: document describes use main functions NMA run multiple network meta-analysis .

title: Run multiple NMA
code: library(NMA) library(dplyr) library(BRugs) library(purrr)

title: Run multiple NMA
text: Define BUGS parameters MCMC.
code: bugs_params <-   list(     PROG = "openBugs",     N.BURNIN = 10,#00,     N.SIMS = 150,#0,     N.CHAINS = 2,     N.THIN = 1,     PAUSE = TRUE)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Nathan Green. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Green N (2022). NMA: Package (One Line, Title Case). R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://icon--r.github.io/NMA.
code: @Manual{,   title = {NMA: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {Nathan Green},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://icon-in-r.github.io/NMA}, }

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Two ways obtain code download zip file clicking green code button . download git open git bash want download package type git clone https://github.com/ICON--R/NMA.git. Build attach package use. run analysis use scripts/run_analysis.R script.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Please note NMA project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: BUGS statistics — bugs_stats
text: BUGS statistics

title: BUGS statistics — bugs_stats
code: bugs_stats(dat, res_bugs, effectParam, random)
